about.title: Hello! I'm <primaryUnderline>Dávid Pap</primaryUnderline>,
about.body:
a Master's student at the University of Pannonia. I chose the Data Science major because I am intrigued by the field of <skyUnderline>machine learning methods</skyUnderline> and because I wanted to deepen my 
<pinkUnderline>software development</pinkUnderline> knowledge, which I acquired previously during my Computer Science BSc. In addition to software development, their deployment and infrastructure are 
also among my areas of interest, including <indigoUnderline>DevOps, virtualization and networking tasks.</indigoUnderline> <break /> 
My hobbies also include IoT and electronics, but I'm also keen on history and geography.

bsc.institution: University of Pannonia - Faculty of Information Technology
bsc.bio: • Mathematics (algebra, logic, calculus, analysis)<break/>• Programming (C/C++, Java, Javascript)<break/>• Parallel programming (OpenMP, MPI)<break/>• Software development (Git, Trello)<break/>• Database management (SQL/T-SQL)<break/>• Operating systems (Bash, Perl)

msc.institution: University of Pannonia - Faculty of Information Technology
msc.bio: • Artificial Intelligence (Python)<break/>• Cloud systems (GCP)<break/>• Statistics, network analysis (R)<break/>• GPU programming (CUDA)

sonrisa.bio: • Container management (Docker, Kubernetes)<break/>• Infrastructure management (AWS, Terraform)<break/>• CI/CD (Gitlab CI)<break/>• Build tools (Maven-Spring, npm)

projects.name: Portfolio site
projects.description: A page whose sole purpose is to introduce myself and for you to learn about my previous projects

projects.name: Bachelor's Thesis
projects.description: In my thesis, I created an in-line WAF tool that inspects the content of HTTP requests. I implemented a traditional signature-based method and a method that uses a Machine Learning approach.

projects.name: Image processing
projects.description: The project was prepared for an image processing class, where filters had to be implemented in OpenCV (in C++) based on given mathematical formulas and convolution kernels

projects.name: Master's Thesis (MSc)
projects.description: In my thesis, I analyzed multilayer commercial networks using, among other things, centrality metrics, unsupervised machine learning methods, and deep learning systems (Autoencoders, Graph Neural Networks).
